newsitem.title: SPAIN: Telefonica sale coordinators to use "green shoe".
newsitem.headline: Telefonica sale coordinators to use "green shoe".

text.p: Coordinators of the share sale of Spanish telecoms operator Telefonica de Espana will exercise the "green shoe" option to buy about 20 million reserve shares to cover excess demand, a source close to the operation said.
The state's sale of its remaining 21 percent stake on Monday was oversubscribed by nine times on the retail tranche and more than four percent on the institutional tranche.
The 20.5 million "green shoe" shares would join the 171 million shares that were allocated to both retail and institutional investors and began quoting on Tuesday.
Telefonica shares gained five pesetas on the institutional tranche price of 3,360 to 3,365 pesetas in early trade.
